comments.body: So my understanding is correct: The flutter keyboard code treats the modifiers as containing the current modifier key info, like if you press left control. But GLFW doesn't include this info, so it would send a modifier without the left control info. Here you are normalizing it by updating the modifier with the current key info?

Yes, more or less.  More accurately, GLFW just sends the value of modifiers as the state *before* the current event, so it lags. All the other platforms set the state of the modifier including the effect of the current event.
